meanings.sent1: The principal reappoints the teacher for another year.
meanings.sent2: The committee reappoints the chairperson for a second term.
meanings.sent3: The cat reappoints the same sunny spot on the windowsill every morning.
meanings.sent4: The sun reappoints its place in the sky each day, bringing light and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The clock reappoints the same hour for lunchtime every day, like clockwork.

meanings.sent1: The supervisor reappoints the tasks to different team members.
meanings.sent2: The manager reappoints the project to a more experienced team.
meanings.sent3: The magician reappoints the same volunteer for another trick, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The conductor reappoints the solo to a different musician, creating a new harmony.
meanings.sent5: The chef reappoints the special dish to the menu, delighting customers with its return.

meanings.definition: To name or assign to a position or duty again.
meanings.sent1: The company reappoints the employee to a leadership role.
meanings.sent2: The government reappoints the ambassador to serve another term.
meanings.sent3: The captain reappoints the same crew member to steer the ship, causing some laughter among the sailors.
meanings.sent4: The coach reappoints the star player as team captain, inspiring the rest of the team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reappoints the class monitor for their excellent performance, setting a good example for others.
